qas.question: Under the reign of who did the Ottoman empire control much of Southeastern Europe?
During what centuries was the Ottoman empire in control of much of Southeast Europe?
How many provinces did the Ottoman empire control at the start of the 17th century?
Along with provinces what type of states did the Ottoman empire have control over?
What regions of Africa were under control of the Ottoman empire?

answers.text: North Africa, and the Horn of Africa

context: During the <a1_0>16th and 17th centuries<a1_0/>, in particular at the height of its power under the reign of <a0_0>Suleiman the Magnificent<a0_0/>, the Ottoman Empire was a multinational, multilingual empire controlling much of Southeast Europe, Western Asia, the Caucasus, <a4_0>North Africa, and the Horn of Africa<a4_0/>. At the beginning of the 17th century the empire contained <a2_0>32 provinces<a2_0/> and numerous <a3_0>vassal states<a3_0/>. Some of these were later absorbed into the Ottoman Empire, while others were granted various types of autonomy during the course of centuries.[dn 4]
